w:r.w:t: This lesson will describe eating, fruit, and introduce other action verbs in conversation. It will also serve as a descriptive reminder of colors, numbers, and other conversation techniques that your student will use when talking to other people.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning
Student sings the song with the teacher
Sing this song with the student and act it o
Write the word to fill in the sentence frame on the slide
Teach the word “apple.” Have the student repeat the word.
Child will have seen the word “apple” in Lesson 1
It would be useful also to bring your own apple prop
TPR: Demonstrate/foreshadow “eating” by taking a bite from an apple
Write the word “apples” on the slide
Have the student repeat the phrase after you.
Repeat the TPR of eating an apple while circling “eats.”
Introduce plurals by circling (or having the student circle) the “s” on apples
Point out that “s” means more than one
Count the bananas in each picture
Circle the “3” and the “s” on 3 bananas
Circle the one banana and three bananas as you say the words.
Have the student repeat after you and do the same.
Demonstrate the plural by counting the bananas, circling the numbers, and the “s”
Write the word “fruit” on the slide
Have the student repeat the word after you
Clap out the syllables with the student.
Work through the word eating with the student.
Use TPR or visual props to help demonst
Use the alphabet song to help the student spell out these words
Match the sight word to the correct fruit
Match the word fruit to all 3 pictures
Prompt the “trick question” (“fruit” matches all 3 pictures)
by asking “Which word is lonely? Where does it belong?”
Ask the student each question: “Can you find the…”
Circle the picture of the child walking
Circle the picture of the child eating
Circle the picture of the child
The student will have seen these words in other lessons
Ask the questions on the slide: “Who is…?” and underline or circle the word
Use TPR to help demonstrate the actions, if necessary
Write the words in the blanks on the slide
Prompt students by identifying incorrect choices: “Will Susan eat the red?” “Does Susan have blue on her dress?”
Draw a line from the sight word to the correct picture
Students will have seen these words in previous lessons
Draw a line from the sight word to the correct picture
demonstrate grouping, circle the child/name, then the object, and then draw a line
Student should pronounce the rhyming words
Circle or underline each rhyming group
Go through these answers with the student. Visual props would be helpful along with the use of TPR
Student will sing the song with the teacher
Sing this song with the student.
By now they should have a firm grasp of this
go through the instructed motions and have fun!
